intro: Junellia alatocarpa, commonly known as the winged fruit junellia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Its unique feature is the fruit, which develops into a woody capsule with wing-like structures, aiding in seed dispersal. Junellia alatocarpa is often found in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and along riverbanks.
